text: Fred E. Soper (February 21, 1854 - June 18, 1930) was an American farmer, livestock dealer, and politician. Soper was born in the town of Brooklyn, Green Lake County, Wisconsin. He moved with his parents to a farm near Ripon, Wisconsin. Soper then bought his own farm and raised livestock. In 1907, Soper served in the Wisconsin State Assembly; he was a Republican.Wisconsin Blue Book, 1907, Biographical Sketch of Fred R. Soper, p. 1149. Soper died of a heart attack in Ripon, Wisconsin.Heart Attack Fatal to F.R. Soper, Ripon, Wisconsin State Journal, June 19, 1930, p. 12. ==External links== * ==References== Category:1854 births Category:1930 deaths Category:People from Ripon, Wisconsin Category:People from Green Lake County, Wisconsin Category:Farmers from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Fred E. Soper
